Articles.Content: I am off next Friday and I get to do one of my favorite things. I get to go to the movies at 9:00AM and eat popcorn and snowcaps before lunch. The fact that I have off from work and the martian comes out next friday is simply fate. I might just have to stay there all day and watch the movie 5 times. It also gets me really excited that I have not seen one bad review for this movie. Every single review praises it. The only bad opinion I heard was that it was too optimistic. Which is exactly what many critiques of the book where so.......HYPE!!!

Real conversation I had with my wife yesterday:

"We need to get a sitter so we can go out for dinner and a movie next weekend." 

"Why?"

"Because Rich Purnell is a steely-eyed missile man." 

"Oh, is that next weekend? Let me call Natalie, I think she's available."

I live in New Zealand. Why is this important? 

BECAUSE THE MARTIAN IS OUT TOMORROW! CLEAR THE TRACK CAUSE THIS HYPE TRAIN HAS NO BRAKES!

In all seriousness, I have organised a rather large group of friends to go in to the nearest movie theatres Premier of the Martian.

Also...I can't hear the word Botanist without feeling excitement, which kinda sucks seeing as we are doing Botany at school ATM.

Now with the NASA announcement of liquid water...I wonder what Watney would do with this knowledge instead then. Maybe still the same thing because he is in no position to collect the perchlorate brine and purify it.

The GF and I watched it last night (I live in the Philippines, so we get to see it two days earlier vs. the US release). I have to say that I love the book more (of course right?), but as a fan of Science Fiction films, especially ones based on "real science", I think this was a lot better than Gravity and Interstellar. I give it a 9/10. And yes, Matt Damon played the Mark Watney character excellently.
